message: The groups Russia is bombing might not be ISIS, but they are not much better. They are Islamists who want to replace Assad with Shirea law. If the United States is supporting any of these groups that would be reckless and wrong. best to stay out of it completely. Syria is of no value to America anyway. The Russians have had a presence there for decades so their intervention is understandable. Besides, I'd like to see how well they do. I believe Russian military might from a conventional standpoint to be fool's gold.

message:
The crusades were ostensibly an effort to """"free"""" the holy land. Particularly Jerusalem. In many cases, as in the siege/ sack of Constantinople in 1204, it turned into a land grab. The crusades did manage to stop the expansion of Islam. Why is any of this pertinent? Because the seeds
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
Harold Lamb. Both are interesting studies of that pivotal time period. As a side bar: if I'm not mistaken military leaders around the world and in The U.S. in particular study historical conflicts and battles to gain understanding of strategies and tactics, and errors of various enemies/combatants. Know your enemy!
